instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2523: What is 820-2523? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no video,  found there to be no power on the <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> line.  traced it back to the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> with no power the entire way.  is the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> the only thing at this point that would be the culprit? or is something signaling the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> to put out <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>? 
If it is the <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> should i try a reball first or should i replace it? 

Thanks 
Nate

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2523</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: no external, no chime and no beeps when i put no memory in and the speaker im testing with a good.  i think this thing has seen its last days... hahah
